Issues.Title: Angular Language Service flags non-Angular TypeScript classes by method name (ngOnInit) in Nx monorepo
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

language-service

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

Angular Language Service (ALS) incorrectly reports an error in non-Angular TypeScript libraries inside an Nx monorepo when a class contains methods named like Angular lifecycle hooks (e.g. ngOnInit).

The diagnostic shown is:

`Class is using Angular features but is not decorated. Please add an explicit Angular decorator.`

This happens even when:

- the project is not Angular
- there are no Angular decorators
- the library is built with @nx/js:tsc
- ESLint rules are disabled
- the file is not part of any Angular compilation

The error disappears immediately when the Angular Language Service extension is disabled, confirming ALS as the source.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true

```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true

```

### Anything else?

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Language Service flags non-Angular TypeScript classes by method name (ngOnInit) in Nx monorepo" (#66598)

Issues.Title: fix(docs-infra): support providing links to multiple symbols within a single line of a code block
Issues.Body:
Previously our system only found the first matching symboling to link to within a code block on each line, now we set up a link for all of the discovered symbols on each line

Fixes #65403
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(docs-infra): support providing links to multiple symbols within a single line of a code block" (#66597)

Issues.Title: build: initial test of TypeScript 6
Issues.Body:
Resolves some initial test failures after updating to TypeScript 6. High-level set of breaking changes:
* `baseUrl` isn't supported anymore. I removed it everywhere and had to update some paths.
* Some `paths` had to be updated to be explicitly relative.
* `--outFile` is deprecated so I had to rework the build for an integration test.
* `"moduleResolution": "node10"` is deprecated so I switched to `nodenext`. As a result, I had to add extensions to some imports.
* There were a handful of type errors that had to be resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: initial test of TypeScript 6" (#66578)

Issues.Title: fix(core): handle Set in class bindings
Issues.Body:
Currently migrating from `[ngClass]` to `[class]` isn't entirely supported, because `[ngClass]` supports `Set` values while `[class]` ignores them.

These changes add a bit of logic to bring them closer together and make the migration easier.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(core): handle Set in class bindings" (#66576)

Issues.Title: Signal Forms - Value type can't extend generics
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Signal Forms - Value type can't extend generics" (#66596)

Issues.Title: fix(forms): fix control value syncing on touch
Issues.Body: Previously we were unconditionally setting the control value back into the value, regardless of if it had actually been changed. This PR changes the logic to flush the pending sync on touch if there is one, or just skip it if there isn't.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(forms): fix control value syncing on touch" (#66595)

Issues.Title: Angular version 18.2.14 has a bug on @Directive standalone compiling
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular version 18.2.14 has a bug on @Directive standalone compiling" (#66593)

Issues.Title: fix(core): prevent event replay from retaining components with elements with listeners
Issues.Body:
Event replay, via the cleanup callback was retaining elements.
Until now this cleanup was only performed on app destroy.
Now we also cleanup the stashed listeners when the component holding the listened element is destroyed.

fixes #66506
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(core): prevent event replay from retaining components with elements with listeners" (#66594)

Issues.Title: refactor(devtools): drop dagre graph type
Issues.Body:
The PR drops the Dagre graph type since `dagre-d3-es` v7.0.14 introduces better typing (the dep has been already bumped). 

Now the `graphlib.Graph` accepts the node and edge types as template types (Sidenote: not sure what's the reason behind this design decision).

Issues.Title: refactor(devtools): snap to root node on signal graph render
Issues.Body:
Drop the old `ResizeObserver` and resize logic in favor of a simpler "snap to root node" (template or first node) functionality.

cc @AleksanderBodurri
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(devtools): snap to root node on signal graph render" (#66583)

Issues.Title: Angular packages are not published in valid Angular Package Format
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

[Angular Package Format](https://angular.dev/tools/libraries/angular-package-format#fesm) defines FESM as "Short for Flattened ES Modules and consists of a file format created by flattening all ES Modules accessible from an entry point into a single ES Module."

Angular currently publishes its packages within an `fesm2022` directory, but the modules are not flattened: the entry points import from other files internal to the package.

This appears to have been broken with Angular 19.

I suspect this is the new-normal, in which case I will find a way to re-bundle them during the linking step so that our build system doesn't choke.
If so, the docs for the APF should be updated, and the files should be moved out of the `fesm2022` directory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Angular packages are not published in valid Angular Package Format" (#66569)

Issues.Title: docs: clarify that FESM can depend on shared chunks
Issues.Body: Closes #66569

Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [aspect_bazel_lib](https://docs.aspect.build/rules/aspect_bazel_lib) | bazel_dep | patch | `2.22.2` → `2.22.5` |
| [aspect_rules_js](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js) | bazel_dep | minor | `2.8.3` → `2.9.1` |
| [aspect_rules_ts](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts) | bazel_dep | patch | `3.8.1` → `3.8.3` |
| [rules_nodejs](https://redirect.github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_nodejs) | bazel_dep | minor | `6.6.2` → `6.7.3` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_js (aspect_rules_js)</summary>

### [`v2.9.1`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/tag/v2.9.1)

Many companies are successfully building with rules\_js.
If you're getting value from the project, please let us know!
Just comment on our [Adoption Discussion](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/discussions/1000).

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_js", version = "2.9.1")

####### Node.js version #########

# By default you get the node version from DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION in @​rules_nodejs//nodejs:repositories.bzl
# Optionally you can pin a different node version:
bazel_dep(name = "rules_nodejs", version = "6.3.0")
node = use_extension("@​rules_nodejs//nodejs:extensions.bzl", "node", dev_dependency = True)
node.toolchain(node_version = "18.14.2")

#################################

npm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "npm", dev_dependency = True)

npm.npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

use_repo(npm, "npm")

pnpm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "pnpm")

# Allows developers to use the matching pnpm version, for example:

# bazel run -- @​pnpm --dir /home/runner/work/rules_js/rules_js install
use_repo(pnpm, "pnpm")
```

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_js",
    sha256 = "b87afa2205b6fa4540e01d2c47b02a92ed67e24e24f738d46c4c8099836a769a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_js-2.9.1",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/download/v2.9.1/rules_js-v2.9.1.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()
```

#### What's Changed

- chore: update Next.js version to 15.2.6 by [@​scottshuffler](https://redirect.github.com/scottshuffler) in [#​2591](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2591)
- Fix fetching npm packages from git repositories by [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)
- fix: do not serialize Label() via "".join() when tar command fails by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2593](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2593)
- chore: add github\_user\_id to bcr metadata.template.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2588](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2588)
- fix(pnpm): Parse integrity hash from package.json packageManager if provided by [@​Geethree](https://redirect.github.com/Geethree) in [#​2596](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2596)
- fix: npm deps on git+https urls by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2592](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2592)
- chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v6 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2523](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2523)
- chore(deps): update peter-evans/create-pull-request action to v8 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2572](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2572)
- chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/publish-to-bcr action to v1.1.0 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2599](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2599)
- test: move babel test deps into test/node-patches/package.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2598](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2598)
- chore(deps): update actions/cache action to v5 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2602](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2602)

#### New Contributors

- [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) made their first contribution in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_ts (aspect_rules_ts)</summary>

### [`v3.8.3`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/tag/v3.8.3)

#### Using [Bzlmod]:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_ts", version = "3.8.3")

rules_ts_ext = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:extensions.bzl", "ext", dev_dependency = True)

rules_ts_ext.deps(
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",
)

use_repo(rules_ts_ext, "npm_typescript")
```

[Bzlmod]: https://bazel.build/build/bzlmod

#### Using legacy WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_ts",
    sha256 = "b3c7925b1409b7d941a566ae2828ddecdb22a90fbe6e8900acdbaae9b602180a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ts-3.8.3",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/download/v3.8.3/rules_ts-v3.8.3.tar.gz",
)

##################

# rules_ts setup #
##################

# Fetches the rules_ts dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,

# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've

# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "rules_ts_dependencies")

rules_ts_dependencies(
    # This keeps the TypeScript version in-sync with the editor, which is typically best.
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",

    # Alternatively, you could pick a specific version, or use
    # load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION")
    # ts_version = LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()

# Register aspect_bazel_lib toolchains;

# If you use npm_translate_lock or npm_import from aspect_rules_js you can omit this block.
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()
```

To use rules\_ts with bazel-lib 2.x, you must additionally register the coreutils toolchain.

```starlark
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_coreutils_toolchains")

register_coreutils_toolchains()
```

- refactor: prepare support for rules\_js v3 by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​878](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/878)
- chore: remove unnecessary aspect\_bazel\_lib version override in tests by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​879](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/879)

Issues.Title: build: update bazel dependencies (main)
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [aspect_bazel_lib](https://docs.aspect.build/rules/aspect_bazel_lib) | bazel_dep | patch | `2.22.2` → `2.22.5` |
| [aspect_rules_js](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js) | bazel_dep | minor | `2.8.3` → `2.9.1` |
| [aspect_rules_ts](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts) | bazel_dep | patch | `3.8.1` → `3.8.3` |
| [rules_nodejs](https://redirect.github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_nodejs) | bazel_dep | minor | `6.6.2` → `6.7.3` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_js (aspect_rules_js)</summary>

### [`v2.9.1`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/tag/v2.9.1)

Many companies are successfully building with rules\_js.
If you're getting value from the project, please let us know!
Just comment on our [Adoption Discussion](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/discussions/1000).

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_js", version = "2.9.1")

####### Node.js version #########

# By default you get the node version from DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION in @​rules_nodejs//nodejs:repositories.bzl
# Optionally you can pin a different node version:
bazel_dep(name = "rules_nodejs", version = "6.3.0")
node = use_extension("@​rules_nodejs//nodejs:extensions.bzl", "node", dev_dependency = True)
node.toolchain(node_version = "18.14.2")

#################################

npm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "npm", dev_dependency = True)

npm.npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

use_repo(npm, "npm")

pnpm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "pnpm")

# Allows developers to use the matching pnpm version, for example:

# bazel run -- @​pnpm --dir /home/runner/work/rules_js/rules_js install
use_repo(pnpm, "pnpm")
```

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_js",
    sha256 = "b87afa2205b6fa4540e01d2c47b02a92ed67e24e24f738d46c4c8099836a769a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_js-2.9.1",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/download/v2.9.1/rules_js-v2.9.1.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()
```

#### What's Changed

- chore: update Next.js version to 15.2.6 by [@​scottshuffler](https://redirect.github.com/scottshuffler) in [#​2591](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2591)
- Fix fetching npm packages from git repositories by [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)
- fix: do not serialize Label() via "".join() when tar command fails by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2593](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2593)
- chore: add github\_user\_id to bcr metadata.template.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2588](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2588)
- fix(pnpm): Parse integrity hash from package.json packageManager if provided by [@​Geethree](https://redirect.github.com/Geethree) in [#​2596](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2596)
- fix: npm deps on git+https urls by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2592](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2592)
- chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v6 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2523](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2523)
- chore(deps): update peter-evans/create-pull-request action to v8 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2572](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2572)
- chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/publish-to-bcr action to v1.1.0 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2599](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2599)
- test: move babel test deps into test/node-patches/package.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2598](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2598)
- chore(deps): update actions/cache action to v5 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2602](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2602)

#### New Contributors

- [@​scottshuffler](https://redirect.github.com/scottshuffler) made their first contribution in [#​2591](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2591)
- [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) made their first contribution in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)
- [@​Geethree](https://redirect.github.com/Geethree) made their first contribution in [#​2596](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2596)

**Full Changelog**: <https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/compare/v2.9.0...v2.9.1>

</details>

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_ts (aspect_rules_ts)</summary>

### [`v3.8.3`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/tag/v3.8.3)

#### Using [Bzlmod]:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_ts", version = "3.8.3")

rules_ts_ext = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:extensions.bzl", "ext", dev_dependency = True)

rules_ts_ext.deps(
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",
)

use_repo(rules_ts_ext, "npm_typescript")
```

[Bzlmod]: https://bazel.build/build/bzlmod

#### Using legacy WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_ts",
    sha256 = "b3c7925b1409b7d941a566ae2828ddecdb22a90fbe6e8900acdbaae9b602180a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ts-3.8.3",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/download/v3.8.3/rules_ts-v3.8.3.tar.gz",
)

##################

# rules_ts setup #
##################

# Fetches the rules_ts dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,

# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've

# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "rules_ts_dependencies")

rules_ts_dependencies(
    # This keeps the TypeScript version in-sync with the editor, which is typically best.
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",

    # Alternatively, you could pick a specific version, or use
    # load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION")
    # ts_version = LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()

# Register aspect_bazel_lib toolchains;

# If you use npm_translate_lock or npm_import from aspect_rules_js you can omit this block.
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()
```

To use rules\_ts with bazel-lib 2.x, you must additionally register the coreutils toolchain.

```starlark
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_coreutils_toolchains")

register_coreutils_toolchains()
```

#### What's Changed

- refactor: prepare support for rules\_js v3 by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​878](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/878)
- chore: remove unnecessary aspect\_bazel\_lib version override in tests by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​879](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/879)

**Full Changelog**: <https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/compare/v3.8.2...v3.8.3>

```starlark
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/download/v3.8.2/rules_ts-v3.8.2.tar.gz",

    # Alternatively, you could pick a specific version, or use
    # load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION")
    # ts_version = LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")
```

</details>

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/compare/v8.0.2...v8.0.3)

- [#​631](https://redirect.github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/pull/631) - **fix support for using an `Intl.Segmenter` with `diffWords`**. This has been almost completely broken since the feature was added in v6.0.0, since it would outright crash on any text that featured two consecutive newlines between a pair of words (a very common case).
- [#​635](https://redirect.github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/pull/635) - **small tweaks to tokenization behaviour of `diffWords`** when used *without* an `Intl.Segmenter`. Specifically, the soft hyphen (U+00AD) is no longer considered to be a word break, and the multiplication and division signs (`×` and `÷`) are now treated as punctuation instead of as letters / word characters.
- [#​641](https://redirect.github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/pull/641) - **the format of file headers in `createPatch` etc. patches can now be customised somewhat**. It now takes a `headerOptions` option that can be used to disable the file headers entirely, or omit the `Index:` line and/or the underline. In particular, this was motivated by a request to make jsdiff patches compatible with react-diff-view, which they now are if produced with `headerOptions: FILE_HEADERS_ONLY`.
- [#​647](https://redirect.github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/pull/647) and [#​649](https://redirect.github.com/kpdecker/jsdiff/pull/649) - **fix denial-of-service vulnerabilities in `parsePatch` whereby adversarial input could cause a memory-leaking infinite loop, typically crashing the calling process**. Also fixed ReDOS vulnerabilities whereby adversarially-crafted patch headers could take cubic time to parse. Now, `parsePatch` should reliably take linear time. (Handling of headers that include the line break characters `\r`, `\u2028`, or `\u2029` in non-trailing positions is also now more reasonable as side effect of the fix.)

</details>

Issues.Title: [signal forms] FormField directive does not work with host directives inputs
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

forms

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

When creating custom form controls using a host directive that implements the FormValueControl interface and exposes shared inputs, the associated FormField directive no longer propagates input updates (for example, required and disabled) to the control.

This behaviour worked as expected in Angular Forms v21.0.1, but appears to have regressed in v21.0.8.

Using host directives to expose and share inputs across components is a common pattern in our codebase. The current behaviour prevents this pattern from working correctly and represents a regression from previous releases. Restoring this functionality would be highly beneficial, as it is relied upon extensively.

A minimal, stripped-down reproduction of this use case is provided below.

**Our directive**
```typescript
// imports....

@Directive({
    standalone: true,
    exportAs: 'isFormControl',
})
export class IsFormControlDirective<ValueType = any> implements FormValueControl<ValueType | null> {
    public readonly value: ModelSignal<ValueType | null> = model<ValueType | null>(null);

    public readonly name: InputSignal<string> = input<string>('');

   public readonly required: InputSignal<boolean> = input<boolean>(false);

    public readonly disabled: InputSignal<boolean> = input<boolean>(false);

    public readonly readOnly: InputSignal<boolean> = input<boolean>(false);

    public readonly touched: ModelSignal<boolean> = model<boolean>(false);

   // continues.....
}
```

**custom control template**
```html
<!-- continued.... -->

@if (isFormFieldControlDirective.label()?.length) {
        <ng-template #labelTemplate>
            <label
                form-label
                [for]="isFormFieldControlDirective.id()"
                [text]="isFormFieldControlDirective.label()"
                [error]="fieldError && !isFormFieldControlDirective.readOnly()"
                [disabled]="isFormFieldControlDirective.disabled()"
                [required]="isFormFieldControlDirective.required()"
                [readOnly]="isFormFieldControlDirective.readOnly()"
            ></label>
        </ng-template>
    }

    <input
        slot="control"
        type="text"
        [attr.id]="isFormFieldControlDirective.id()"
        [attr.inputMode]="inputMode()"
        [attr.aria-invalid]="fieldError"
        [disabled]="isFormFieldControlDirective.disabled()"
        [error]="fieldError"
        [required]="isFormFieldControlDirective.required()"
        [placeholder]="isFormFieldControlDirective.placeholder()"
        [value]="isFormFieldControlDirective.value()"
        (input)="isFormFieldControlDirective.value.set($event.target.value)"
        (blur)="isFormFieldControlDirective.onBlur()"
    />

   <!-- continued.... -->
```

**text control**
```typescript
@Component({
    // continued .....
    hostDirectives: [
        {
            directive: IsFormControlDirective,
            inputs: ['label', 'placeholder', 'name', 'touched', 'readOnly', 'disabled', 'required'],
            outputs: ['formControlBlur', 'formControlChange'],
        },
// continued. ....
    ],
    exportAs: 'textInput',
})
export class TextInputComponent implements IFormFieldControl {
  // continued.....
}
```

**form template**
```html
<!-- continued... -->
<form-text-input
                                        [field]="editForm.name"
                                        [label]="labelMap.name"
                                    />

<!-- continued... -->
```

**form typescript**
```typescript
public override readonly editForm: FieldTree<FormModel> = form(
        this.editFormModel,
        (schema: SchemaPathTree<FormModel>): void => {
            required(schema.name);
            required(schema.currencyCode);

            disabled(schema.name, (): boolean => this.saving());
            disabled(schema.currencyCode, (): boolean => this.saving());

            readonly(schema.name, (): boolean => !this.canEdit());
            readonly(schema.currencyCode, (): boolean => !this.canEdit());

// continued ...
        },
    );

```

Issues.Title: Angular Elements imported by Angular have inconsistent lifecycle
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

elements

### Is this a regression?

No. This has been the case for as long as I have used Angular, at least 3 years.

### Description

When an Angular component imports another Angular component, `ngOnInit`, `effect`s and `resource`s are called once the inputs are set.

When an Angular component imports an **Angular Elements element**, `ngOnInit`, `effect`s and `resource`s are called before the inputs are set.

There seems to be no alternative lifecycle hook to know when the inputs have indeed been set.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-fpq5sqat?file=src%2Fmain.ts,src%2Fsub-component.ts,src%2Findex.html,package.json

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
In the Angular component, `ngOnInit` is correctly called with values.

In the Angular Elements element, `ngOnInit` is called with undefined inputs.
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
See Stackblitz, 21.1.0 for all the packages. However, this dates back at least to Angular 15.
```

### Anything else?

If an input is marked as required, the following error is logged.

```
Error: NG0950: Input "id" is required but no value is available yet. Find more at https://v21.angular.dev/errors/NG0950
```

Note that this error only applies for dynamic inputs. With the following example, `language = input.required()` does work.

```html
<component-as-element [id]="id()" language="de" />
```

I have also tested with `[attr.]`, to force that the fields are passed as attributes rather than properties, with the hope that this would mean that they could be passed as soon as the element is created, but this did not change anything.

```html
<component-as-element [attr.id]="id()" [attr.language]="language()" />
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Angular Elements imported by Angular have inconsistent lifecycle" (#66588)

Issues.Title: Cannot apply queryParameters to current route with Router.navigate
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

In my application, I use the following code to apply a generated session Id to my current route with the following code:
`this.router.navigate([], {
      queryParamsHandling: 'merge',
      queryParams: {host: this.sessionId()}
    });`
This worked fine in Angular 20 and before, however after updating to Angular 21, this code now throws the error:
`NG04002: Cannot match any routes. URL Segment: 'error;errorCode=RestrictedByContext'`

Is this particular use case not supported anymore? In the documentation of read roud state, it still shows a similar example being used:
https://angular.dev/guide/routing/read-route-state

Issues.Title: reset formModel to initial state
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

  "dependencies": {
    "@angular/animations": "^21.1.0",
    "@angular/common": "^21.1.0",
    "@angular/compiler": "^21.1.0",
    "@angular/core": "^21.1.0",
    "@angular/forms": "^21.1.0",
    "@angular/platform-browser": "^21.1.0",
    "@angular/router": "^21.1.0",
    "@azure/msal-angular": "^4.0.23",
    "@azure/msal-browser": "^4.26.1",
    "@azure/msal-common": "^15.13.0",
    "@vitest/browser-playwright": "^4.0.15",
    "ngxsmk-datepicker": "^2.0.4",
    "rxjs": "~7.8.2",
    "tslib": "^2.3.0"
  },

### Description

if i use a form model:

```
export const myFormModel = signal<IMyObject>({
    id: '',
    name: ''
}
```

together with a schema:

```
export const mySchema: Schema<IMyObject> = schema<IMyObject>((p) => {
    required(p.id, { message: 'Enter the id' });
    required(p.name, { message: 'Enter the name' });
    minLength(p.name, 3, { message: 'Minimum of 3 characters' });
}
```

to set up a form:

`  protected readonly myForm = form(myFormModel , mySchema);`

and create a new object, that is fine.

if i then want to edit an object using a form with similar setup, fine. 

but if i then want to create a new object, the formModel hangs on to the old values and populates the new form with those values, when what i would hope for is an empty form. i need to reset the form by manually resetting each individual value. can there be a method i can call that will automagically do this for me?


### Proposed solution

a method i can call such as myFormModel .reset();

### Alternatives considered

i can, and currently do,  of course write my own reset model for each and every object, some of which have many properties.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "reset formModel to initial state" (#66581)

compiler, forms

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Form data type like this was working earlier, but now it gives type error:
```ts
interface LoginData {
  email: string | null;
  password: string | null;
  rememberMe: boolean;
}
```

Form:
```ts
 loginModel = signal<LoginData>({
    email: null,
    password: null,
    rememberMe: false,
  });

  loginForm = form(this.loginModel);
```

This PR contains the following updates:

| [aspect_rules_ts](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts) | bazel_dep | patch | `3.8.1` → `3.8.3` |
| [rules_nodejs](https://redirect.github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_nodejs) | bazel_dep | minor | `6.6.2` → `6.7.3` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_js (aspect_rules_js)</summary>

### [`v2.9.1`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/tag/v2.9.1)

Many companies are successfully building with rules\_js.
If you're getting value from the project, please let us know!
Just comment on our [Adoption Discussion](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/discussions/1000).

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_js", version = "2.9.1")

####### Node.js version #########

# By default you get the node version from DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION in @​rules_nodejs//nodejs:repositories.bzl
# Optionally you can pin a different node version:
bazel_dep(name = "rules_nodejs", version = "6.3.0")
node = use_extension("@​rules_nodejs//nodejs:extensions.bzl", "node", dev_dependency = True)
node.toolchain(node_version = "18.14.2")

#################################

npm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "npm", dev_dependency = True)

npm.npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

use_repo(npm, "npm")

pnpm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "pnpm")

# Allows developers to use the matching pnpm version, for example:

# bazel run -- @​pnpm --dir /home/runner/work/rules_js/rules_js install
use_repo(pnpm, "pnpm")
```

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_js",
    sha256 = "b87afa2205b6fa4540e01d2c47b02a92ed67e24e24f738d46c4c8099836a769a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_js-2.9.1",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/download/v2.9.1/rules_js-v2.9.1.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()
```

#### What's Changed

- chore: update Next.js version to 15.2.6 by [@​scottshuffler](https://redirect.github.com/scottshuffler) in [#​2591](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2591)
- Fix fetching npm packages from git repositories by [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)
- fix: do not serialize Label() via "".join() when tar command fails by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2593](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2593)
- chore: add github\_user\_id to bcr metadata.template.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2588](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2588)
- fix(pnpm): Parse integrity hash from package.json packageManager if provided by [@​Geethree](https://redirect.github.com/Geethree) in [#​2596](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2596)
- fix: npm deps on git+https urls by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2592](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2592)
- chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v6 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2523](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2523)
- chore(deps): update peter-evans/create-pull-request action to v8 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2572](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2572)
- chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/publish-to-bcr action to v1.1.0 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2599](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2599)
- test: move babel test deps into test/node-patches/package.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2598](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2598)

#### Using legacy WORKSPACE

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_ts",
    sha256 = "b3c7925b1409b7d941a566ae2828ddecdb22a90fbe6e8900acdbaae9b602180a",

##################

# rules_ts setup #
##################

# Fetches the rules_ts dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,

# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've

# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "rules_ts_dependencies")

rules_ts_dependencies(
    # This keeps the TypeScript version in-sync with the editor, which is typically best.
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",

    # Alternatively, you could pick a specific version, or use
    # load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION")
    # ts_version = LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()

# Register aspect_bazel_lib toolchains;

# If you use npm_translate_lock or npm_import from aspect_rules_js you can omit this block.
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()
```

To use rules\_ts with bazel-lib 2.x, you must additionally register the coreutils toolchain.

```starlark
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_coreutils_toolchains")

register_coreutils_toolchains()
```

|---|---|---|---|

| [aspect_rules_js](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js) | bazel_dep | minor | `2.8.3` → `2.9.1` |
| [aspect_rules_ts](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts) | bazel_dep | patch | `3.8.1` → `3.8.3` |

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_js (aspect_rules_js)</summary>

### [`v2.9.1`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/tag/v2.9.1)

Many companies are successfully building with rules\_js.
If you're getting value from the project, please let us know!
Just comment on our [Adoption Discussion](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/discussions/1000).

#### Using Bzlmod with Bazel 6:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_js", version = "2.9.1")

####### Node.js version #########

# By default you get the node version from DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION in @​rules_nodejs//nodejs:repositories.bzl
# Optionally you can pin a different node version:
bazel_dep(name = "rules_nodejs", version = "6.3.0")
node = use_extension("@​rules_nodejs//nodejs:extensions.bzl", "node", dev_dependency = True)
node.toolchain(node_version = "18.14.2")

#################################

npm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "npm", dev_dependency = True)

npm.npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

use_repo(npm, "npm")

pnpm = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:extensions.bzl", "pnpm")

# Allows developers to use the matching pnpm version, for example:

# bazel run -- @​pnpm --dir /home/runner/work/rules_js/rules_js install
use_repo(pnpm, "pnpm")
```

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")

http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_js",
    sha256 = "b87afa2205b6fa4540e01d2c47b02a92ed67e24e24f738d46c4c8099836a769a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_js-2.9.1",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/releases/download/v2.9.1/rules_js-v2.9.1.tar.gz",
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()
```

#### What's Changed

- chore: update Next.js version to 15.2.6 by [@​scottshuffler](https://redirect.github.com/scottshuffler) in [#​2591](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2591)
- Fix fetching npm packages from git repositories by [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)
- fix: do not serialize Label() via "".join() when tar command fails by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2593](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2593)
- chore: add github\_user\_id to bcr metadata.template.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2588](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2588)
- fix(pnpm): Parse integrity hash from package.json packageManager if provided by [@​Geethree](https://redirect.github.com/Geethree) in [#​2596](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2596)
- fix: npm deps on git+https urls by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2592](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2592)
- chore(deps): update actions/checkout action to v6 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2523](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2523)
- chore(deps): update peter-evans/create-pull-request action to v8 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2572](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2572)
- chore(deps): update bazel-contrib/publish-to-bcr action to v1.1.0 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2599](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2599)
- test: move babel test deps into test/node-patches/package.json by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​2598](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2598)
- chore(deps): update actions/cache action to v5 by [@​renovate](https://redirect.github.com/renovate)\[bot] in [#​2602](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2602)

#### New Contributors

- [@​scottshuffler](https://redirect.github.com/scottshuffler) made their first contribution in [#​2591](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2591)
- [@​thomasdraebing](https://redirect.github.com/thomasdraebing) made their first contribution in [#​2403](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2403)
- [@​Geethree](https://redirect.github.com/Geethree) made their first contribution in [#​2596](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/pull/2596)

**Full Changelog**: <https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_js/compare/v2.9.0...v2.9.1>

</details>

```starlark
load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()

# Register aspect_bazel_lib toolchains;

# If you use npm_translate_lock or npm_import from aspect_rules_js you can omit this block.
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()
```

To use rules\_ts with bazel-lib 2.x, you must additionally register the coreutils toolchain.

```starlark
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_coreutils_toolchains")

register_coreutils_toolchains()
```

#### What's Changed

- fix: trigger auto-release when updating typescript version by [@​alexeagle](https://redirect.github.com/alexeagle) in [#​864](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/864)

**Full Changelog**: <https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/compare/v3.8.1...v3.8.2>

</details>

2. Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "rules_nodejs", version = "6.7.3")
```

#### Using WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE.bazel` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "rules_nodejs",

    strip_prefix = "rules_nodejs-6.7.3",

)
```

- chore: test on bazel 9 by [@​alexeagle](https://redirect.github.com/alexeagle) in [#​3880](https://redirect.github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_nodejs/pull/3880)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: update cross-repo angular dependencies (main)" (#32282)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): allow application assets in workspace root
Issues.Body:
This commit refactors `normalizeAssetPatterns` to:
1. Allow asset paths located in the workspace root or project root, relaxing the previous strict requirement of being within the source root.
2. Determine the output path by calculating the relative path from the most specific root (source, project, or workspace) to the asset input.
3. Remove the unused `MissingAssetSourceRootException` class in favor of a standard `Error` with a clear message.

This enables users to include workspace-level assets (like `LICENSE` or `README.md`) using the shorthand string syntax without errors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/build): allow application assets in workspace root" (#32309)

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): optimize package manager version detection
Issues.Body:
This commit introduces a "hot cache" mechanism for the package manager version. When the package manager factory determines the version (e.g., to distinguish between Yarn and Yarn Classic), it now passes that discovered version to the `PackageManager` instance.

The `PackageManager` class has been updated to:
1. Accept an optional `version` in its constructor options.
2. Cache the version internally after the first fetch.
3. Use the cached/injected version in `getVersion()` to avoid redundant shell commands.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(@angular/cli): optimize package manager version detection" (#32308)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): prevent incorrect catch binding removal in downleveled for-await
Issues.Body:
When `async-await` is disabled (e.g., in Zone.js applications) and the build target is ES2019 or higher, esbuild may incorrectly remove the catch binding of a downleveled `for await...of` loop during minification.

This change explicitly disables the `optional-catch-binding` feature in esbuild when `async-await` support is disabled, forcing esbuild to retain the catch binding and avoiding the minification bug.

Closes #32298
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/build): prevent incorrect catch binding removal in downleveled for-await" (#32307)

Issues.Title: ng serve / ng build does not work with windows junctions
Issues.Body:
### Command

build, serve

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using the Angular Application Builder (@angular/build:browser) on Windows 11 (or Windows Server 2022), script tags are not injected into index.html if the project is accessed through a Windows junction.

This happens when `preserveSymlinks: true` is configured and occurs both during ng serve and ng build.

The same project works correctly when:
- accessed via its real filesystem path (not through a junction), or
- built using the legacy Webpack builder (@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser).

No errors or warnings are reported during the build or serve process.

This issue is the same as #27119 and is still reproducible with Angular 21.

Expected behavior

- index.html should contain the injected script tags

Actual behavior

- index.html is generated without any script tags
- The page loads as a blank page
- No CLI errors or warnings are shown
- The build output otherwise appears successful

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create a new Angular project:
`ng new junction-repro`
`cd junction-repro`

2. Enable symlink preservation:
add `"preserveSymlinks": true` in angular.json

3. Create a Windows junction pointing to the project directory:
`mklink /J C:\temp\junction-repro C:\realpath\junction-repro`

4. Open the project via the junction path:
`cd C:\temp\junction-repro`
`ng serve`

5. Open the application in the browser.


see also #27119 for a setup with Dev Drives

### Exception or Error

```text
There is no error shown.
```

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI       : 21.0.5
Angular           : 21.0.8
Node.js           : 24.11.0
Package Manager   : npm 11.6.1
Operating System  : win32 x64

┌───────────────────────────┬───────────────────┬───────────────────┐
│ Package                   │ Installed Version │ Requested Version │
├───────────────────────────┼───────────────────┼───────────────────┤
│ @angular/build            │ 21.0.5            │ ^21.0.5           │
│ @angular/cli              │ 21.0.5            │ ^21.0.5           │
│ @angular/common           │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ @angular/compiler         │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ @angular/compiler-cli     │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ @angular/core             │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ @angular/forms            │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ @angular/platform-browser │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ @angular/router           │ 21.0.8            │ ^21.0.0           │
│ rxjs                      │ 7.8.2             │ ~7.8.0            │
│ typescript                │ 5.9.3             │ ~5.9.2            │
│ vitest                    │ 4.0.17            │ ^4.0.8            │
└───────────────────────────┴───────────────────┴───────────────────┘
```

### Anything else relevant?

The issue does not occur when:
- running the same project from its real filesystem path
- switching to the webpack builder:
`"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser"`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng serve / ng build does not work with windows junctions" (#32306)

Issues.Title: Error when running test with vitest after upgrading from v21.0 to v21.1
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

21.0

### Description

With the latest v21.1.0 version, it's now impossible to run unit-test with vitest when there is scss assets in ng-package.json
When running the command `ng test`, the CLI will stop with error
```
Error: The {scss file listed in ng-package.json} asset path must start with the project source root.
```

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular/cli): decouple `AnalyticsCollector` from `CommandContext`
Issues.Body:
The `AnalyticsCollector` class is made more modular and easier to test by removing its direct dependency on the `CommandContext`. Instead of accepting the entire context object, the constructor now receives only the specific dependencies it requires: the logger, user ID, and package manager information.
Also removes a circular reference:
`packages/angular/cli/src/analytics/analytics-collector.ts` → `packages/angular/cli/src/command-builder/command-module.ts`

Issues.Title: modelcontextprotocol/sdk should be a peerDependency
Issues.Body:
### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Given how impossible it is in npm to exclude a transitive dependency, there is good reason for the @modelcontextprotocol/sdk to be a peer dependency.

- It is for an experimental feature (see docs at https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/3f13db87e27f6ffc207fc642979776606a71fcec/adev/src/content/ai/develop-with-ai.md?plain=1#L34C1-L34C41).
- It involves code to start a local server so is inherently more risky.
- It requires specific setup outside of the Angular CLI (a given local AI tool needs the MCP endpoint configuring)

Please change this so that we reduce bloat and security related overhead unless we choose to actually use it.

### Minimal Reproduction

npm audit -> mcp related CVEs fail a check despite it not being used

Issues.Title: Incorrect branch coverage with Vitest on Node 24 (V8 13.6)
Issues.Body:
### Command

test

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When defining or using Angular signals, coverage shows an uncovered branch marker at the end of the line. Likely a source-map quirk. Similar issue exists, but note: on Node 22 (V8 12.x) coverage is correct; on Node 24 (V8 13.6) phantom branches appear.

### Minimal Reproduction

Steps to reproduce:

1. Create project: `npx @angular/cli@21.0.5 new coverage-v8`
2. Add coverage provider: `npm i -D @vitest/coverage-v8`
3. Update angular.json test options:
```
"options": {
  "coverage": true
}
```
4. Run tests: `npm run test`
Coverage summary shows **91.66%** in app.ts **instead of 100%**. It reports **11/12 branches covered**; the uncovered branch is on the line where the signal is defined.

_Note: On Node 22 (V8 12.x), this works flawlessly. The incorrect coverage appears on Node 24 (V8 13.x)._

### Exception or Error

```text

```

### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI       : 21.0.5
Angular           : 21.0.8
Node.js           : 24.13.0
```

Issues.Title: build: update dependency node to v22.22.0 (main)
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|
| [node](https://nodejs.org) ([source](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node)) | minor | `22.21.1` → `22.22.0` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>nodejs/node (node)</summary>

### [`v22.22.0`](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/releases/tag/v22.22.0): 2026-01-13, Version 22.22.0 'Jod' (LTS), @​marco-ippolito

[Compare Source](https://redirect.github.com/nodejs/node/compare/v22.21.1...v22.22.0)

This is a security release.

##### Notable Changes

lib:

- (CVE-2025-59465) add TLSSocket default error handler
- (CVE-2025-55132) disable futimes when permission model is enabled
  lib,permission:
- (CVE-2025-55130) require full read and write to symlink APIs
  src:
- (CVE-2025-59466) rethrow stack overflow exceptions in async\_hooks
  src,lib:
- (CVE-2025-55131) refactor unsafe buffer creation to remove zero-fill toggle
  tls:
- (CVE-2026-21637) route callback exceptions through error handlers

##### Commits

Issues.Title: TypeScript 5.9 Build Error: Cannot destructure property 'pos' of 'file.referencedFiles[index]'
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When building an Angular 21 application with TypeScript 5.9.2, the build fails with a TypeScript compiler error during the `getOptionsDiagnostics` phase. The error occurs in TypeScript's internal code when processing file references.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

_No response_

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
X [ERROR] Cannot destructure property 'pos' of 'file.referencedFiles[index]' as it is undefined. [plugin angular-compiler]

    node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:126740:9:
      126740 │       ({ pos, end } = file.referencedFiles[index]);
             ╵          ^

    at getReferencedFileLocation (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:126740:10)
    at fileIncludeReasonToDiagnostics (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:133580:31)
    at processReason (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:130143:62)
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at createDiagnosticExplainingFile (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:130095:42)
    at node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:130028:15
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>)
    at Object.getCombinedDiagnostics (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:130024:78)
    at getProgramDiagnostics (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:127993:57)
    at getSemanticDiagnosticsForFile (node_modules/typescript/lib/typescript.js:128024:7)

  This error came from the "onStart" callback registered here:

    node_modules/@angular/build/src/tools/esbuild/angular/compiler-plugin.js:120:18:
      120 │             build.onStart(async () => {
          ╵                   ~~~~~~~

    at setup (node_modules/@angular/build/src/tools/esbuild/angular/compiler-plugin.js:120:19)
    at async handlePlugins (node_modules/esbuild/lib/main.js:1185:20)
```

### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 21.0.5
Angular: 21.0.5
TypeScript: 5.9.2
npm: 10.9.3
OS: Windows 10
```

### Anything else?

## Configuration Files

### tsconfig.json
```json
{
  "compileOnSave": false,
  "compilerOptions": {
    "strict": true,
    "noImplicitOverride": true,
    "noPropertyAccessFromIndexSignature": true,
    "noImplicitReturns": true,
    "noFallthroughCasesInSwitch": true,
    "skipLibCheck": true,
    "skipDefaultLibCheck": true,
    "esModuleInterop": true,
    "allowSyntheticDefaultImports": true,
    "isolatedModules": true,
    "experimentalDecorators": true,
    "importHelpers": true,
    "target": "ES2022",
    "module": "preserve",
    "useDefineForClassFields": false,
    "lib": ["ES2022", "dom"],
    "moduleResolution": "bundler",
    "baseUrl": "./src",
    "paths": {
      "@app/*": ["app/*"],
      "@common/*": ["app/common/*"],
      "@services/*": ["app/services/*"],
      "@components/*": ["app/components/*"],
      "@shared/*": ["app/shared/*"],
      "@environments/*": ["environments/*"]
    }
  },
  "angularCompilerOptions": {
    "enableI18nLegacyMessageIdFormat": false,
    "strictInjectionParameters": true,
    "strictInputAccessModifiers": true,
    "strictTemplates": true
  },
  "files": [],
  "references": [
    {
      "path": "./tsconfig.app.json"
    },
    {
      "path": "./tsconfig.spec.json"
    }
  ]
}
```

## Attempted Workarounds

1. ✅ Removed project references from `tsconfig.json` - Error persists
2. ✅ Added `skipDefaultLibCheck: true` - Error persists
3. ✅ Tried `disableReferencedProjectLoad: true` - Error persists
4. ✅ Excluded backup files from compilation - Error persists
5. ✅ Tested both TypeScript 5.9.2 and 5.9.3 - Error persists in both
6. ✅ Cleared npm cache and performed clean install - Error persists
7. ✅ Cleared Angular build cache - Error persists

## Additional Notes

- The error occurs during the TypeScript compiler's `getOptionsDiagnostics` phase
- The error happens in TypeScript's internal code, not in the project's source code
- The build process completes the bundling phase but fails during type checking
- This appears to be a bug in TypeScript 5.9.x when used with Angular 21's build system
- The error is consistent and reproducible on every build attempt

Issues.Title: feat-bug(aria/combobox-listbox): listbox `[multi]="true"` works only for combobox `readonly` true
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

If listbox's `multi=true` and combobox's `readonly=false` we can select only one item. We can only type first letters of countries. And select only one country. We can't use even standard `, ` separator.

If listbox's multi=true and combobox's readonly=true we can open combobox/listbox and select multiple items.

See live: [stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/edit/stackblitz-starters-28c5sjlj?file=src%2Fcombobox%2Fcombobox.html,src%2Fmain.ts)

### Use Case

It's useful for multiselect, autocomplete

Issues.Title: build: update bazel dependencies (21.1.x)
Issues.Body:
This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Type | Update | Change |
|---|---|---|---|
| [aspect_rules_ts](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts) | bazel_dep | patch | `3.8.1` → `3.8.3` |
| [rules_nodejs](https://redirect.github.com/bazel-contrib/rules_nodejs) | bazel_dep | minor | `6.6.2` → `6.7.3` |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>aspect-build/rules_ts (aspect_rules_ts)</summary>

### [`v3.8.3`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/tag/v3.8.3)

#### Using [Bzlmod]:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_ts", version = "3.8.3")

rules_ts_ext = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:extensions.bzl", "ext", dev_dependency = True)

rules_ts_ext.deps(
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",
)

use_repo(rules_ts_ext, "npm_typescript")
```

[Bzlmod]: https://bazel.build/build/bzlmod

#### Using legacy WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
http_archive(
    name = "aspect_rules_ts",
    sha256 = "b3c7925b1409b7d941a566ae2828ddecdb22a90fbe6e8900acdbaae9b602180a",
    strip_prefix = "rules_ts-3.8.3",
    url = "https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/download/v3.8.3/rules_ts-v3.8.3.tar.gz",
)

##################

# rules_ts setup #
##################

# Fetches the rules_ts dependencies.
# If you want to have a different version of some dependency,

# you should fetch it *before* calling this.
# Alternatively, you can skip calling this function, so long as you've

# already fetched all the dependencies.
load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "rules_ts_dependencies")

rules_ts_dependencies(
    # This keeps the TypeScript version in-sync with the editor, which is typically best.
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",

    # Alternatively, you could pick a specific version, or use
    # load("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:repositories.bzl", "LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION")
    # ts_version = LATEST_TYPESCRIPT_VERSION
)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:repositories.bzl", "rules_js_dependencies")

rules_js_dependencies()

load("@​aspect_rules_js//js:toolchains.bzl", "DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION", "rules_js_register_toolchains")

rules_js_register_toolchains(node_version = DEFAULT_NODE_VERSION)

load("@​aspect_rules_js//npm:repositories.bzl", "npm_translate_lock")

npm_translate_lock(
    name = "npm",
    npmrc = "//:.npmrc",
    pnpm_lock = "//:pnpm-lock.yaml",
    verify_node_modules_ignored = "//:.bazelignore",
)

load("@​npm//:repositories.bzl", "npm_repositories")

npm_repositories()

# Register aspect_bazel_lib toolchains;

# If you use npm_translate_lock or npm_import from aspect_rules_js you can omit this block.
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies")

aspect_bazel_lib_dependencies()
```

To use rules\_ts with bazel-lib 2.x, you must additionally register the coreutils toolchain.

```starlark
load("@​aspect_bazel_lib//lib:repositories.bzl", "register_coreutils_toolchains")

register_coreutils_toolchains()
```

#### What's Changed

- refactor: prepare support for rules\_js v3 by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​878](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/878)
- chore: remove unnecessary aspect\_bazel\_lib version override in tests by [@​jbedard](https://redirect.github.com/jbedard) in [#​879](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/pull/879)

**Full Changelog**: <https://github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/compare/v3.8.2...v3.8.3>

### [`v3.8.2`](https://redirect.github.com/aspect-build/rules_ts/releases/tag/v3.8.2)

#### Using [Bzlmod]:

Add to your `MODULE.bazel` file:

```starlark
bazel_dep(name = "aspect_rules_ts", version = "3.8.2")

rules_ts_ext = use_extension("@​aspect_rules_ts//ts:extensions.bzl", "ext", dev_dependency = True)

rules_ts_ext.deps(
    ts_version_from = "//:package.json",
)

use_repo(rules_ts_ext, "npm_typescript")
```

[Bzlmod]: https://bazel.build/build/bzlmod

#### Using legacy WORKSPACE

Paste this snippet into your `WORKSPACE` file:

```starlark
load("@​bazel_tools//tools/build_defs/repo:http.bzl", "http_archive")
```

Issues.Title: bug(mat-stepper): changing the stepper orientation causes re-rendering of matStepContent elements
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Lazily rendered elements marked with `matStepContent` are destroyed and created again when stepper orientation changes (e.g. `BreakpointObserver`). This bug excludes embedding stateful components in `matStepContent`.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/l9vuejno-v1tqaa3f
Steps to reproduce:
1. Move to second step
2. Change screen resolution to match breakpoint


### Expected Behavior

The randomly generated number should remain unchanged

### Actual Behavior

The randomly generated number changes

### Environment

- Angular: 21.0.0
- CDK/Material: 21.0.0
- Browser(s): Chromium Version 137.0.7151.68 (Official Build) (64-bit)
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Pop!_OS 22.04 LTS x86_64
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-stepper): changing the stepper orientation causes re-rendering of matStepContent elements" (#32641)

Issues.Title: bug(cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport): Virtual scroll keeps elements in memory on destruction
Issues.Body: ### Is this a regression? - [x] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version ### The previous version in which this bug was not present was 19.2.15 ### Description Items wrapped in cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport persists in memory even after the destruction of the virtual scroll element. ### Reproduction StackBlitz link: https://acasmhd5.stackblitz.io Steps to reproduce: 1. Click toggle button a couple of times 2. Create a memory snapshot 3. Check elements in the memory snapshot ### Expected Behavior cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport does a cleanup on destruction, does not retain elements. ### Actual Behavior cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport keep elements in memory even after destruction. ### Environment - Angular: 20.2.0 - CDK/Material: 20.2.0 - Browser(s): Google Chrome 141.0.7390.108, Firefox 146.0.1 - Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport): Virtual scroll keeps elements in memory on destruction" (#32632)
